tsetse

Welcome!

This is a collection of various variants on the card game Set. They are all original ideas developed by members of Epsilon Theta.

An average of 1 physical deck exists in the universe for each of these variants. If you want to try playing with them, come visit ET. I promise it's worth it.

The rules for each variant are explained below.

C53T

difficulty: very hard

cards: 125 (deal 12)

pronounced "see-set"

Here is an example of a set in C53T:

A set consists of exactly 5 cards such that for each pentagon (light, medium, and dark), the 5 pentagons overlaid on top of each other form a pattern with a line of reflectional symmetry. In the above example, the light pentagon is symmetric across the red line, the medium pentagon is symmetric across the orange line, and the dark pentagon is symmetric across all 5 lines.

Here is a sketch of all the ways for the lines on a set of 5 cards to be symmetric, up to rotation:

The underlying mathematical object is (C5)3, whence the name; here C5 denotes the natural torsor for the cyclic group of order 5. The rule can equivalently be stated as "pick 5 cards that add to the identity".

FOLD

difficulty: hard

cards: 98 (deal 12)

pronounced "fold-set"

FO1D

difficulty: medium

cards: 70 (deal 12)

pronounced "foyd-set"

OCTA

difficulty: easy

cards: 48 (deal 9)

pronounced "octaset"

A5SET

difficulty: medium

cards: 60 (deal 10)

pronounced "asset"

Credits

Many ET people contributed to creating these variants; these include Alex Bean, Andy Tockman (who made this website), Dylan Hendrickson (who printed the physical decks), Josh Brunner, Joshua Ani, and Yan Sheng Ang.
